intro: Gyrostemon pungens, commonly known as the prickly gyrostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Gyrostemon pungens is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
